page.title: 16Farmer, Sutton-cum-Lound
page.content: We went on a visit to Mr. Kent's Corner Farm to ask him some questions.Mr. Kent first started as a farm worker many years ago. He has another farm three miles away. He farms 34O acres. They have 2OO acres of crops and l4O acres of grass. He has l3O cows and two bulls. He has l3O calves each year but he only keeps 6O calves and sells the rest. Mr. Kent also has 4 pigs and a few sheep. He grows corn and sugar beet. In the winter they feed the cows on sugar beet pulp, brewers grains, rolled barley and cow cake. They have to be milked twice a day. Mr. Kent gets 2OO tons of barley each year and 4OO tons of sugar beet. He has 2 full-time workers who start work at 6.OO a.m. and finish work at 6.OO p.m. The busiest time of the year is harvest time. (Contined on Page l7)
